description: The vRtrLdpStateChange notification is generated when the LDP
protocol is created or deleted in the router.

Summary.eval: ($v1==2) ? 'LDP protocol is deleted from router' : 'LDP protocol is created in router'

description: The desired state for LDP on this virtual router. An attempt
to set vRtrLdpStatus to 'delete' will fail if the LDP
protocol is not in the administrative outOfService state
i.e. TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpGenAdminState must be set
to 'outOfService'.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrLdpStatus

description: The vRtrLdpInstanceStateChange notification is generated when the LDP
module changes state either administratively or operationally.

event.Summary: LDP instance operational state : $v2, admin state : $v1

description: The value of vRtrLdpGenAdminState specifies the desired
administrative state for this LDP instance.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpGenAdminState

description: The value of vRtrLdpGenOperState specifies the current
operational state of this LDP instance.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpGenOperState

description: Used by vRtrLdpInstanceStateChange, the value indicates the reason
for the LDP instance state change.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpInstanceNotifyReasonCode

description: The vRtrLdpIfStateChange notification is generated when the LDP
interface changes state either administratively or operationally.

event.Summary: LDP interface operational state : $v2, admin state : $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpIfStateChange TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpIfAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpIfOperState i 1 TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpIfOperDownReason i 0

description: The value of vRtrLdpIfAdminState indicates the desired administrative
state for LDP on this interface or targeted peer.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpIfAdminState

description: The value of vRtrLdpIfOperState specifies the current operational
state of LDP on this interface or targeted peer.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpIfOperState

description: The value of vRtrLdpIfOperDownReason specifies the reason
that the LDP interface or targeted peer is operationally
down.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpIfOperDownReason

description: The vRtrLdpSvcIdMismatch notification is generated when there is
a mismatch of local and remote service IDs.

event.Summary: LDP service ID (local: $v1, remote: $v2) mismatch occurred

description: Used by vRtrLdpSvcIdMismatch, the value indicates the local
Service ID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpNotifyLocalServiceID

description: Used by vRtrLdpSvcIdMismatch, the value indicates the remote
Service ID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpNotifyRemoteServiceID

description: The vRtrLdpGroupIdMismatch notification is generated when there is
a mismatch of local and remote group IDs.

event.Summary: LDP group ID (local: $v1, remote: $v2) mismatch occurred

description: Used by vRtrLdpGroupIdMismatch, the value indicates the local
Group ID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpNotifyLocalGroupID

description: Used by vRtrLdpGroupIdMismatch, the value indicates the remote
Group ID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-LDP-MIB::vRtrLdpNotifyRemoteGroupID
